title: Ticket #4783: Add stats for job reconnects after schedd restart
description:
We'd like to have statistics on how the schedd recovers from a restart, specifically how many jobs it's able to reconnect with.

The following schedd statistics will be added:

  • JobsRestartReconnectsFailed (job count)
  • JobsRestartReconnectsLeaseExpired (job count)
  • JobsRestartReconnectsSucceeded (job count)
  • JobsRestartReconnectsAttempting (job count)
  • JobsRestartReconnectsInterrupted (job count)
  • JobsRestartReconnectsBadput (accumulated time)

At startup, the schedd initializes JobsRestartReconnectsAttempting to the number of shadows it will start in reconnect mode, initializes JobsRestartReconnectsLeaseExpired to the number of jobs it won't create reconnect shadows for because the job lease has already expired, initializes JobsRestartReconnectsBadput to the current run time of jobs counted in JobsRestartReconnectsLeaseExpired, and initializes the other stats to zero.

The shadow_rec struct has a new bool member named reconnect_succeeded, which is initialized to false.

If the shadow is born with the -reconnect argument and exits because it cannot reconnect to the job (either because the lease expired or the startd/starter refused it), it should use the new exit code JOB_RECONNECT_FAILED instead of JOB_SHOULD_REQUEUE. Note that if the shadow successfully reconnects and then subsequently fails to reconnect if disconnected in the future, it should still exit with JOB_SHOULD_REQUEUE. When a shadow exits with the new shadow exit code JOB_RECONNECT_FAILED, the schedd decrements JobsRestartReconnectsAttempting, increments JobsRestartReconnectsFailed, and increases JobsRestartReconnectsBadput by the current run time of the job. For all other purposes, JOB_RECONNECT_FAILED should be treated like JOB_SHOULD_REQUEUE.

When a shadow updates the job attribute NumJobReconnects (and increases the value), if the shadow_rec has is_reconnect==true and reconnect_succeeded==false, the schedd decrements JobsRestartReconnectsAttempting and increments JobsRestartReconnectsSucceeded and sets reconnect_succeeded=true.
